verses.text: Even to-day \add is\add* my complaint bitter: my stroke is heavier than my groaning.
Oh that I knew where I might find him! \add that\add* I might come \add even\add* to his seat!
I would order \add my\add* cause before him, and fill my mouth with arguments.
I would know the words \add which\add* he would answer me, and understand what he would say to me.
Would he plead against me with \add his\add* great power? No; but he would put \add strength\add* in me.
There the righteous might dispute with him; so should I be delivered for ever from my judge.
Behold, I go forward, but he \add is\add* not \add there\add* ; and backward, but I cannot perceive him:
On the left hand, where he doth work, but I cannot behold \add him\add* : he hideth himself on the right hand, that I cannot see \add him\add* :
But he knoweth the way that I take: \add when\add* he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.
My foot hath held his steps, his way have I kept, and not declined.
Neither have I gone back from the commandment of his lips; I have esteemed the words of his mouth more than my necessary \add food\add* .
But he \add is\add* in one \add mind\add* , and who can turn him? and \add what\add* his soul desireth, even \add that\add* he doeth.
For he performeth \add the thing that is\add* appointed for me: and many such \add things are\add* with him.
Therefore am I troubled at his presence: when I consider, I am afraid of him.
For God maketh my heart soft, and the Almighty troubleth me:
Because I was not cut off before the darkness, \add neither\add* hath he covered the darkness from my face.
